Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • jig.engine.hli.AbstractSimpleGame
      • jig.engine.hli.StaticScreenGame
        • World

  • public class World
extends jig.engine.hli.StaticScreenGame
    This class is the main class of the Frogger game that has to be run in order for the game to be launched. The World class implements all of the obstacles and pads, as well as the weather objects. It also sets up the references to the sprite sheet in order for the UI of the game to work.
    Version:
    May 21, 2016
    Author:
    Uday Tripathi and Vaishnav Balaji, Period: 5, Assignment: Frogger Final Project, Sources: None

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int GameLives
      The default number of lives for the frog to cross the river
      int GameScore
      The starting score for the user
      int levelTimer
      The timer that keeps track of how long a frog has been on a level

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      World()
      Constructs a world object that enables game play Calls the superclass's constructor (StaticGameScreen) to instantiate the game Displays the images from the sprite sheet and creates the various layers to be displayed on the screen Instantiates the instance variables frog, frogCol, ui, lightning, and goal manager to prepare for game play

      • obstacleCycle

        public void obstacleCycle(long time)
        Cycles the objects through the screen
        Parameters:
        time - the amount of time that the object should be on the screen

      • beginLevel

        public void beginLevel(int levelNumber)
        Called when the game begins at the specified level. Creates the dynamic objects on the river and on the road based on the level. On higher levels, the objects are created to move faster and make the level tricker for the user.
        Parameters:
        levelNumber - the level number at which the game is to begin.

      • inputKey

        public void inputKey()
        Implements the necessary commands for user's pressing of the keys on the keyboard

        Processes the commands by the user on the keyboard

      • inputAdvanceLevel

        public void inputAdvanceLevel()
        Once a level is completed, this method allows for the user to advance to the next level by pressing the "Space" key

      • update

        public void update(long time)
        Abstract method implementation. Updates all the obstacles and objects on the screen at their various locations
        Overrides:
        update in class jig.engine.hli.StaticScreenGame
        Parameters:
        time - at which the game is currently at

      • main
